qas.question: What was a primary cause of the modification of Roman architectural elements?
What Roman construction material has continued to be a mystery to this day?
Do any Roman structures still exist in our time?

answers.text: even after more than 2,000 years some Roman structures still stand magnificently

qas.question: What facet of the capital city was emulated by other urban centers in the Roman Republic?

context: Over time, Roman architecture was modified as their <a0_0>urban requirements changed<a0_0/>, and the civil engineering and building construction technology became developed and refined. The <a1_0>Roman concrete<a1_0/> has remained a riddle, and <a2_0>even after more than 2,000 years some Roman structures still stand magnificently<a2_0/>. <a3_0>The architectural style<a3_0/> of the capital city was emulated by other urban centers under Roman control and influence. Roman cities were well planned, efficiently managed and neatly maintained.[citation needed]
